slots.description: menu items to be listed in the menu

members.name: touchStartY
members.description:
iPad scroll detection properties

This feature prevents menu item selection during iPad scrolling to avoid
accidental selections when users are trying to scroll through a long menu.

How it works:
1. On touchstart: Record initial Y position and timestamp
2. On touchmove: Calculate vertical movement and time elapsed
3. If movement > threshold AND time < threshold: Mark as scrolling
4. On touchend: Reset scrolling state after a delay
5. During selection: Prevent selection if scrolling is detected

This prevents the common iPad issue where users accidentally select menu
items while trying to scroll through the menu content.

Threshold Values:
- Movement threshold: 10px (consistent with Card component click vs. drag detection)
- Time threshold: 300ms (consistent with longpress duration across the design system)
- Reset delay: 100ms (allows final touch events to be processed)

These values are carefully chosen to balance preventing accidental triggers
while allowing intentional scroll gestures. They represent a common UX pattern
in mobile interfaces and are consistent with other components in the design system.

members.name: scrollThreshold
members.description:
Minimum vertical movement (in pixels) required to trigger scrolling detection.

This threshold is consistent with other components in the design system:
- Card component uses 10px for click vs. drag detection
- Menu component uses 10px for scroll vs. selection detection

The 10px threshold is carefully chosen to:
- Allow for natural finger tremor and accidental touches
- Distinguish between intentional scroll gestures and taps
- Provide consistent behavior across the platform

members.name: scrollTimeThreshold
members.description:
Maximum time (in milliseconds) for a movement to be considered scrolling.

This threshold is consistent with other timing values in the design system:
- Longpress duration: 300ms (ActionButton, LongpressController)
- Scroll detection: 300ms (Menu component)

Quick movements within this timeframe are likely intentional scrolls,
while slower movements are more likely taps or selections.

members.name: isScrolling
members.description:
Public getter for scrolling state
Returns true if the component is currently in a scrolling state

members.name: label
members.description: label of the menu

members.name: ignore
members.description: whether menu should be ignored by roving tabindex controller

members.name: selects
members.description:
how the menu allows selection of its items:
- `undefined` (default): no selection is allowed
- `"inherit"`: the selection behavior is managed from an ancestor
- `"single"`: only one item can be selected at a time
 - `"multiple"`: multiple items can be selected

members.name: value
members.description: value of the selected item(s)

members.name: selected
members.description: selected items values as string

members.name: selectedItems
members.description: array of selected menu items

members.name: shouldSupportDragAndSelect
members.description:
Whether to support the pointerdown-drag-pointerup selection strategy.
Defaults to false to prevent click/touch events from being captured
behind the menu tray in mobile environments (since the menu closes
immediately on pointerup).

members.name: childItems
members.description: child items managed by menu

members.name: childRole
members.description:
Hide this getter from web-component-analyzer until
https://github.com/runem/web-component-analyzer/issues/131
has been addressed.

members.name: resolvedSelects
members.description: menuitem role based on selection type

members.name: resolvedRole
members.description: menu role based on selection type

members.name: onFocusableItemAddedOrUpdated
members.description:
When a descendant `<sp-menu-item>` element is added or updated it will dispatch
this event to announce its presence in the DOM. During the CAPTURE phase the first
Menu based element that the event encounters will manage the focus state of the
dispatching `<sp-menu-item>` element.

members.name: onSelectableItemAddedOrUpdated
members.description:
When a descendant `<sp-menu-item>` element is added or updated it will dispatch
this event to announce its presence in the DOM. During the BUBBLE phase the first
Menu based element that the event encounters that does not inherit selection will
manage the selection state of the dispatching `<sp-menu-item>` element.

members.name: focusOnFirstSelectedItem
members.description: for picker elements, will set focus on first selected item

members.name: handleTouchStart

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The TouchEvent from the touchstart event

members.description:
Handles touchstart events for iPad scroll detection.

Records the initial touch position and timestamp to establish a baseline
for detecting scroll gestures. Only processes single-touch events to
avoid interference with multi-touch gestures.

members.name: handleTouchMove

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The TouchEvent from the touchmove event

members.description:
Handles touchmove events for iPad scroll detection.

Calculates the vertical movement distance and time elapsed since touchstart.
If the movement exceeds the threshold (10px) and happens within the time
threshold (300ms), it marks the interaction as scrolling. This helps
distinguish between intentional scroll gestures and accidental touches.

members.name: handleTouchEnd
members.description:
Handles touchend events for iPad scroll detection.

Resets the scrolling state after a short delay (100ms) to allow for
any final touch events to be processed. This delay prevents immediate
state changes that could interfere with the selection logic.

The 100ms delay is consistent with the design system's approach to
touch event handling and ensures that any final touch events or
gesture recognition can complete before the scrolling state is reset.

members.name: getNeighboringFocusableElement

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: return the item before; default is false

members.description:
given a menu item, returns the next focusable menu item before or after it;
if no menu item is provided, returns the first focusable menu item

members.name: prepareToCleanUp
members.description: on focus, removes focus from focus styling item, and updates the selected item index

events.name: change
events.description: Announces that the `value` of the element has changed

attributes.description:
how the menu allows selection of its items:
- `undefined` (default): no selection is allowed
- `"inherit"`: the selection behavior is managed from an ancestor
- `"single"`: only one item can be selected at a time
 - `"multiple"`: multiple items can be selected
attributes.name: selects
ignore
attributes.description: whether menu should be ignored by roving tabindex controller

slots.description: menu items to be listed in the group

members.name: ownRole
members.description:
a menu group must have the role `group`
and should never function as a menu

members.name: controlsRovingTabindex
members.description:
only a menu controls roving tabindex;
groups should defer navigation to parent menu

declarations.description: Fires when a menu item is added or updated so that a parent menu can track it.
declarations.name: MenuItemAddedOrUpdatedEvent

declarations.description: Fires to forward keyboard event information to parent menu.
declarations.name: MenuItemKeydownEvent

slots.description: text content to display within the Menu Item
description to be placed below the label of the Menu Item

slots.description: icon element to be placed at the start of the Menu Item

members.name: active
members.description: whether the menu item is active or has an active descendant

members.name: focused
members.description: whether the menu item has keyboard focus

members.name: selected
members.description: whether the menu item is selected

members.name: value
members.description: value of the menu item which is used for selection

members.name: hasSubmenu
members.description: whether the menu item has a submenu

members.name: noWrap
members.description: whether menu item text content should not wrap

members.name: focusElement
members.description: the focusable element of the menu item

members.name: open
members.description: whether submenu is open

members.name: _openedViaKeyboard
members.description: whether menu item's submenu is opened via keyboard

members.name: _closedViaPointer
members.description: whether menu item's submenu is closed via pointer leave

members.name: manageSubmenu
members.description: determines if item has a submenu and updates the `aria-haspopup` attribute

members.name: isInputElement
members.description:
Determines if an element is an input field that should retain focus.
Uses multiple detection strategies to identify input elements generically.

members.name: isNativeInputElement
members.description: Checks if an element is a native HTML input element.

members.name: isSpectrumInputComponent
members.description:
Checks if an element is a Spectrum Web Component with input behavior.
Uses ARIA roles and component patterns for generic detection.

members.name: handleKeydown
members.description: forward key info from keydown event to parent menu

members.name: handleSubmenuChange
members.description:
When there is a `change` event in the submenu for this item
then we "click" this item to cascade the selection up the
menu tree allowing all submenus between the initial selection
and the root of the tree to have their selection changes and
be closed.

members.name: menuData
members.default: { // menu that controls ArrowUp/ArrowDown navigation focusRoot: undefined, parentMenu: undefined, // menu or menu group that controls selection selectionRoot: undefined, cleanupSteps: [], }

events.description: announces the item has been added so a parent menu can take ownerships
